intro: Labisia neriifolia, commonly known as the black-leaved labisia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and can be propagated through stem cuttings. Labisia neriifolia is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
